A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
My excitement to see this movie was a solid geek 10.  My disappointment after seeing it is now equally high. Didn't\, Rian\, why?
Luke Skywalker is a cinematic piece of gold. Royalty. And you made him spend half the film whining\, half the film being scared\, half the film crabbing\, then set him up for a great duel\, but instead made him a hologram quickly fading into force dust. Why?  Why not do something cool?  My 5 year old could have given you a better Luke Plot. Throwing away the lightsaber?  Why?  So dumb.  We spend a whole movie waiting for that moment and then you irreverently crap all over it. It's OK to celebrate the lore and mystique. DO NOT KILL THE PAST. Maybe Rian got a little too caught up in Kylo?    

This film should be called "The Wasted Potential."  Kathleen Kennedy should be removed as the "caretaker."  Bring back the mystique and mythos. This is a Space Opera\, not Spaceballs. It was depressing to watch Luke play a parody of himself. The FA set up so manny potentially great payoffs and none came through.  I have never been more disappointed seeing a film.
